Detailed Description

cellarr is an object used to write arrays of dcell or ccell into file.

Mainly used to output PSF into files.

Function Documentation

Initializing an cellarray object that contains arrays of dmat, cmat, dcell or ccell. 

00032                                                     {
00033     format2fn;
00034     cellarr *out=calloc(1, sizeof(cellarr));
00035     out->fn=fn;
00036     out->fp=zfopen(fn,"wb");
00037     out->cur=0;
00038     out->tot=tot;
00039     uint32_t magic=MCC_ANY;
00040     uint64_t totx=out->tot,toty=1;
00041     zfwrite(&magic, sizeof(uint32_t),1,out->fp);
00042     zfwrite(&totx,sizeof(uint64_t),1,out->fp);
00043     zfwrite(&toty,sizeof(uint64_t),1,out->fp);
00044     return out;
00045 }

00079                                {
00080     if(ca->cur !=ca->tot){
00081     warning("cellarr is initialized with %ld elements, "
